title: Contributor Covenant Code of Conduct
text: members, contributors, leaders pledge make participation community harassment-free experience everyone, regardless age, body size, visible invisible disability, ethnicity, sex characteristics, gender identity expression, level experience, education, socio-economic status, nationality, personal appearance, race, caste, color, religion, sexual identity orientation. pledge act interact ways contribute open, welcoming, diverse, inclusive, healthy community.

title: Contributor Covenant Code of Conduct
text: Examples behavior contributes positive environment community include: Demonstrating empathy kindness toward people respectful differing opinions, viewpoints, experiences Giving gracefully accepting constructive feedback Accepting responsibility apologizing affected mistakes, learning experience Focusing best just us individuals, overall community Examples unacceptable behavior include: use sexualized language imagery, sexual attention advances kind Trolling, insulting derogatory comments, personal political attacks Public private harassment Publishing others’ private information, physical email address, without explicit permission conduct reasonably considered inappropriate professional setting

title: Contributor Covenant Code of Conduct
text: Community leaders responsible clarifying enforcing standards acceptable behavior take appropriate fair corrective action response behavior deem inappropriate, threatening, offensive, harmful. Community leaders right responsibility remove, edit, reject comments, commits, code, wiki edits, issues, contributions aligned Code Conduct, communicate reasons moderation decisions appropriate.

title: Contributor Covenant Code of Conduct
text: Code Conduct applies within community spaces, also applies individual officially representing community public spaces. Examples representing community include using official e-mail address, posting via official social media account, acting appointed representative online offline event.

title: Contributor Covenant Code of Conduct
text: Instances abusive, harassing, otherwise unacceptable behavior may reported community leaders responsible enforcement codeofconduct@posit.co. complaints reviewed investigated promptly fairly. community leaders obligated respect privacy security reporter incident.

title: Contributor Covenant Code of Conduct
text: Community Impact: serious violation community standards, including sustained inappropriate behavior. title: Contributor Covenant Code of Conduct
text: Community Impact: Demonstrating pattern violation community standards, including sustained inappropriate behavior, harassment individual, aggression toward disparagement classes individuals. Consequence: permanent ban sort public interaction within community.

title: Contributor Covenant Code of Conduct
text: Code Conduct adapted Contributor Covenant, version 2.1, available https://www.contributor-covenant.org/version/2/1/code_of_conduct.html. Community Impact Guidelines inspired [Mozilla’s code conduct enforcement ladder][https://github.com/mozilla/inclusion]. answers common questions code conduct, see FAQ https://www.contributor-covenant.org/faq. Translations available https://www.contributor-covenant.org/translations.

title: Contributing to apr
text: outlines propose change apr. detailed discussion contributing tidyverse packages, please see development contributing guide code review principles.

title: Contributing to apr
text: can fix typos, spelling mistakes, grammatical errors documentation directly using GitHub web interface, long changes made source file. generally means ’ll need edit roxygen2 comments .R, .Rd file. can find .R file generates .Rd reading comment first line.

title: Contributing to apr
text: want make bigger change, ’s good idea first file issue make sure someone team agrees ’s needed. ’ve found bug, please file issue illustrates bug minimal reprex (also help write unit test, needed). See guide create great issue advice.

title: Contributing to apr
text: Fork package clone onto computer. haven’t done , recommend using usethis::create_from_github("11rchitwood/apr", fork = TRUE). Install development dependencies devtools::install_dev_deps(), make sure package passes R CMD check running devtools::check(). R CMD check doesn’t pass cleanly, ’s good idea ask help continuing. Create Git branch pull request (PR). recommend using usethis::pr_init("brief-description--change"). Make changes, commit git, create PR running usethis::pr_push(), following prompts browser. title PR briefly describe change. body PR contain Fixes #issue-number. user-facing changes, add bullet top NEWS.md (.e. just first header). Follow style described https://style.tidyverse.org/news.html.

title: Contributing to apr
text: New code follow tidyverse style guide. can use Air apply style, please don’t restyle code nothing PR. use roxygen2, Markdown syntax, documentation. use testthat unit tests. Contributions test cases included easier accept.

title: Contributing to apr
text: Please note apr project released Contributor Code Conduct. contributing project agree abide terms.

title: Getting help with apr

title: Getting help with apr
text: Armed reprex, next step figure ask. ’s question: start community.rstudio.com, /StackOverflow. people answer questions. ’s bug: ’re right place, file issue. ’re sure: let community help figure ! problem bug feature request, can easily return report . opening new issue, sure search issues pull requests make sure bug hasn’t reported /already fixed development version. default, search pre-populated :issue :open. can edit qualifiers (e.g. :pr, :closed) needed. example, ’d simply remove :open search issues repo, open closed.

title: Authors and Citation
text: Ryan Chitwood. Author, maintainer.

title: Authors and Citation
text: Chitwood R (2025). apr: Array Programming R. R package version 0.0.0.9000, https://github.com/11rchitwood/apr.
code: @Manual{,   title = {apr: Array Programming R},   author = {Ryan Chitwood},   year = {2025},   note = {R package version 0.0.0.9000},   url = {https://github.com/11rchitwood/apr}, }

title: Copilot Instructions
text: Commit Often: Make small, frequent commits clear messages. Use present tense, imperative mood (“Add feature” ” added feature”). Branching: Use branches new features bug fixes. Merge back main branch complete. Pull Requests: Use pull requests code reviews discussions merging changes.

title: Copilot Instructions
text: Prefer using stopifnot() error handling applicable.
code: # Good stopifnot(length(x) == prod(value))  # Bad if (length(x) != prod(value)) {   stop("New dimensions must match the number of elements in x") }

title: Copilot Instructions
text: Use Test-Driven Development (TDD) developing new feature. Write test new feature watch fail (red). Write minimum amount code necessary make test pass (green). Clean code keeping test green (refactor). Repeat process new features changes.

title: Copilot Instructions
text: suggesting changes code review, use TDD well. , make suggested change explicit writing failing test. , follow TDD process make test pass refactor code needed.

what: Find index of first occurrence Finds the index of the first occurrence of each element in the right argument within the left argument. — apr_index_of
title: Find index of first occurrence Finds the index of the first occurrence of each element in the right argument within the left argument. — apr_index_of

text: x haystack (left argument) y needle (right argument)

text: integer vector shape y, containing index first occurrence element x. Elements found return length(x) + 1.

what: Reverse along a specified axis — apr_reverse
title: Reverse along a specified axis — apr_reverse
text: Reverses elements along specified axis array. vector, reverses entire vector. arrays, can specify axis reverse. default, reverses along last axis. similar APL's bracket notation ⌽[K] reverses along axis K.

title: Reverse along a specified axis — apr_reverse
Reverse along a specified axis — apr_reverse
text: x array vector along integer specifying axis reverse along (default: last axis)

title: Reverse along a specified axis — apr_reverse
text: array specified axis reversed

title: Reverse along a specified axis — apr_reverse

what: Rotate along a specified axis — apr_rotate
title: Rotate along a specified axis — apr_rotate
text: Rotates elements along specified axis array. vector, rotates entire vector k positions. arrays, can specify axis rotate. default, rotates along last axis. similar APL's bracket notation k⌽[]X rotates X k positions along axis .

title: Rotate along a specified axis — apr_rotate
Rotate along a specified axis — apr_rotate
text: x array vector k integer, number positions rotate along integer specifying axis rotate along (default: last axis)

title: Retrieve the shape of an array — apr_shape
code: arr <- array(1:12, c(3, 2, 2)) apr_shape(arr)  # Returns c(3, 2, 2) #> [1] 3 2 2

title: Transpose an array — apr_transpose
text: Reverses dimensions array. 2D matrix, standard transpose. higher dimensional arrays, reverses order dimensions.

title: Transpose array axes — apr_transpose_axes
text: Permutes dimensions array according specified order. dyadic form transpose, similar R's aperm function.
